uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools
Class ShapefileReader

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.ShapefileReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
DataSource
public class ShapefileReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataSource

A class to simplify the process of loading an ESRI(r) Shapefile. It is effectivly a wrapper for the Shapefile class.

This class will open the shapefile (both .shp and .dbf if avaiable) after which calls to readLines,readPolygons and readData will extract the necasary information out of the shapefile.

The class also has a series of getTheme() methods that encapsulate the process of building themes (complet with layer and shaders) as a v.easy way of setting up a theme for inclusion in a viewer.

Author:
James Macgill, Center for computational Geography., David Robison ArcM code and bug fixes

base: - url of file without extention e.g. 'name' not 'name.shp'
idCol - An int giving the number of the colum to take the feature ids from.

ShapefileReader

public ShapefileReader(java.net.URL base)
Constructs a shapefile reader from a base url. This is the best constructor to use if you do not know the id column for the shapefile
Parameters:
base - The base url for the shapefile (i.e. leave the .shp off the end if possible)

getShapeType

public int getShapeType()
gets the shape type for this shapefile.
Returns:
int The type of feature, constants defined in shapefile match the values given, for example Shapefile.POLYGON;

getTheme

public Theme getTheme()
Reads the data in this shapefile and produces a theme for use in a Viewer.
Returns:
Theme a theme containing the features of the shapefile

getLayer

public Layer getLayer()
Reads the data in this shapefile and produces a layer for use in a Theme.
Returns:
Layer a Layer containing the features of the shapefile

getTheme

public Theme getTheme(Shader shade,
                      java.lang.String colName)
Gets a theme based on the given shader and colName as a bonus the method configures the shaders range for you by reading the min and max values from the named column
Parameters:
shade - a RampShader to shade this theme (includes HSV,sat and val shaders)
colName - the name of the column to grab the data from

getTheme

public Theme getTheme(java.lang.String colName,
                      java.awt.Color c)
convinience version of get theme (shade,colname) provides a default satShader with the specified color
Parameters:
colName - A string containing the name of the .dbf col to shade by
c - A color to shade with.

readLines

public Layer readLines()
Reads the feature information from the shapefile and produces a LineLayer for use in a Theme. This will only work if the feature type is line or polygon otherwise it will fail
Returns:
LineLayer a LineLayer containing the lines from this shapefile.
See Also:
getShapeType

readLinesM

public Layer readLinesM()

readData

public GeoData[] readData()
Fills geodata objects with all of the data found in the shapefiles .dbf file and indexes it by the shapefiles idColumn. If during construction no ID collumn was given then it will be guessed based on the feature type (not always successfull)
Returns:
GeoData[] An array of SimpleGeoData's, one for each collum in the .dbf

readData

public GeoData readData(int col)
Fills a geodata objects with the data found in the shapefiles .dbf file from the specified collumg and indexes it by the shapefiles idColumn. If during construction no ID collumn was given then it will be guessed based on the feature type (not always successfull)
Parameters:
col - An int representing the col to read the data from
Returns:
GeoData A SimpleGeoData

readData

public GeoData readData(SimpleGeoData data,
                        int col)

readData

public GeoData readData(java.lang.String colName)
Fills a geodata objects with the data found in the shapefiles .dbf file from the specified collumg and indexes it by the shapefiles idColumn. If during construction no ID collumn was given then it will be guessed based on the feature type (not always successfull)
Parameters:
colName - A String representing the col to read the data from
Returns:
GeoData A SimpleGeoData

readPolygons

public Layer readPolygons()
Reads the feature information from the shapefile and produces a PolygonLayer for use in a Theme. This will only work if the feature type is polygon otherwise it will fail. Modidied JM 10/May/2000 Polygons created without 0,0 centroid so that GeoPolygon will auto calculate this
Returns:
LineLayer a LineLayer containing the lines from this shapefile.
See Also:
getShapeType

readPoints

public Layer readPoints()
Reads the feature information from the shapefile and produces a PointLayer for use in a Theme. This will only work if the feature type is point otherwise it will fail.
Returns:
PointLayer a PointLayer containing the points from this shapefile.
See Also:
getShapeType
